title: India should compensate PCB: Sarfraz Nawaz
text:
Sunday, 11 October 2015 15:45 Posted by Shoaib-ur-Rehman Siddiqui 
ISLAMABAD: Former Test Cricketer Sarfraz Nawaz on Sunday said if India doesn't play a series against Pakistan this December in the UAE then India should compensate the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) financially for the loss. 
Sarfraz said while talking to APP that India has always given us a cold shoulder. 
"Pakistan should stop thinking about India and must move on," he said adding many other better teams waiting to play against Pakistan. 
He said "though the International Cricket Council (ICC) is fully influenced by Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) but still the PCB must go to them in this regard," he said. 
Speaking about Shahid Afridi, he said if Afridi wouldn't have been made the 2016 Twenrty-20 World Cup skipper than he would have been struggling for a place in the team as he has no individual performance and doesn't deserve to be in the squad. Pakistan won the recently concluded T20 series against Zimbabwe with Afridi scoring just two runs in each match. 
He bowled three overs for 23 runs in the first T20 and went wicket-less while in the second T20 Afridi bowled four overs giving away 26 runs without taking any wicket. 
Sarfraz said a player like Afridi who just performs once in a blue moon cannot be trusted. 
It is pertinent to mention that Afridi also performed poor in the National T20 Cup held at Rawalpindi in September and when Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Shahryar Khan was asked about it, he said Afridi is capable of enormous success and is a match winner who can turn around the game at any stage. He also assured to support the all-rounder for the T20 WC. 
Sarfraz said it is the foolishness on part of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) as they have time and again given chance to Afridi after he has not performed. 
"PCB should not go on ifs and buts hoping that Afridi would perform some day," he said adding what is the mistake of other deserving players who are far more better than him. 
Talking about the ICC keeping an eye of Pakistan off-spinners bowling actions, he said our umpires should check the doubtful actions in the domestic circuit. 
Commenting on Younis Khan, Sarfraz said Younis deserves a place in the ODI squad as a player like him can stand on the crease for 50 overs but our other players cannot. Copyright APP (Associated Press of Pakistan), 2015
